Problem:
Consider a complex function \\( z(t) = e^{it} \\) where t represents time. We investigate the influence of a Fourier transformation on this function, represented as \\( F(z) = \\int_{-\\infty}^{\\infty} z(t) e^{-i\\omega t} dt \\) over the frequency domain \\( \\omega \\).

Knowing the Fourier transformed outcome, can we pinpoint whether a plain or time-varying phase shift was implemented on \\( z(t) \\) during the transformation?
Explanation: Multiple differing phase shifts can yield similar alterations in the Fourier domain, especially if these phase shifts produce similar spectral modifications. Without additional data on precise phase shift dependencies, multiple plausible transformations could lead to the observed frequencies in the Fourier domain.
